title: I cannot access switch web interface from Firefox.
content:
I have a problem with Firefox 97.0 where I cannot access a networking switches web interface.

The network is setup with a wireless router connected to two switches - switch_1 and switch_2.

I am connected to the router via wifi and can ping both switches and get a response from both. If I try to access web interface at switch_1 I am ok but when I try to access web interface of switch_2, I get a 'The connection has timed out' error.

There are no plug-ins or extensions in Firefox and the web interface is located on a local IP address 192.168.1.12 for switch_1 and 192.168.1.13 for switch_2.

Both switches are the same make, model and have the same latest firmware installed.

I have tried accessing the web interface of both switches from Internet Explorer too and I can access both.

I have also tried another computer and can access web interfaces on both switches from Firefox and Internet Explorer, so now points to a Firefox issue on a specific computer.

Both computers anti-virus and firewall are configured the same and have even been disabled but I get the same behaviour from both switches using both browsers on both computers - so, protection does not appear to be a factor.

So, the problem lies with Firefox refusing to connect to one web interface on a specific computer. I'm not aware of any settings which would prevent this.

Does anyone have any ideas.
creator: cosmarchy

title: Disable new-downloads dropdown menu.
content:
In the latest Firefox update a very annoying new "feature" arrived. When you download something, an automatic drop down menu appears in the top toolbar and stays there until the file is being downloaded and closed after some seconds after the download is finished. You can click of course somewhere to make it vanish.

This is TOO ANNOYING. It also covers a portion of the main page. How can i disable this behavior and return to the old one where nothing appears automatically?

title: Firefox não abre as páginas.
content:
Algumas vezes quando abro o Firefox, que é meu navegador padrão, e vou acessar algum site ele simplesmente não abre a página e não faz o menor esforço para carregar, tento abrir vários sites e ele continua apenas rodando devagar, mas não abre nada. Tenho que fechar e abrir o navegador diversas vezes até que consiga abrir uma página, isso é muito frustrante.

Agora em qualquer outro navegador que eu utilize consigo abrir normalmente.

Esse problema não acontece 100% das vezes, mas é muito incômodo. Seria alguma configuração relacionada com o hardware? Eu já desativei a aceleração tão quanto ja ativei novamente e não vi diferença nenhuma, não tenho muitos programas abertos consumindo ram para ter esse tipo de problema e no gerenciador de tarefas também está tudo "normal", as vezes o firefox aparenta estar consumindo menos ram do que deveria, quando esse problema acontece.

Já realizei a limpeza de cache, histórico e cookies. Já passei antivirus e meu windows e firefox já estão atualizados.

Não sei mais o que fazer.

So, is there a way to disable this thing without completely removing the download progress indicator from my toolbar?

Thanks again for the help!

title: Firefox and thunderbird: invisible dropdown menus / missing overlay planes
content:
Hi all, due to the occurring problem I cannot select topic to describe best my type of question:

Description of fault: Using Open Suse Leap current version 15.3 (KDE) with all patches installed (zypper dup: no action required) In either thunderbird and firefox application (but e.g. not in dolphin or k3b or gimp...) I have following problem: When pressing any entry in File ... View... bar I do not get a visible dropdown menu to chose from Firefox specific: When I try to use a bookmark folder in the bookmark bar there is no visible dropdown menu to chose from When I try to chose from a dropdown menu inside the content of a web site i will get no visible feedback at all.

BUT: when I want to chose a bookmark that should appear in a dropdown list and I move the mouse to that remembered position I see in the lower left corner the bookmark's address and I can chose it! The same happens with the dropdown menus from the the File.... View... Help line. I am able to chose a command once I remember where to point to.

So I guess all what is missing is the overlay plane where the menu contents reside.

This problem occurs in 95% of the time I use both applications, BUT there are 5% of the time where everything works like a charm. I have no idea what i do differently in that usage. Whenever Firefox works normal, also thunderbird does. Is it somehow a KDE releated problem?

How can I fix that problem? Any hints?

Thank you

Johannes

title: Firefox Nightly Pausing Visuals on Video When Overlayed by Another Program
content:
Hi there! I use a transparent version of Discord so I can watch videos through the client on Firefox while using Discord itself. This used to not be an issue at all, but at some point recently, Nightly had an update that stopped me from being able to do this by pausing the video's visuals a few seconds after I tab into Discord. My theory is that it's to save resources in performance, but I'd like to figure out how to revert this so I can do what I did previously. example

Things tried so far: hardware acceleration on/off using different types of video outside of Firefox to make sure it wasn't Discord/Windows freezing it different websites besides YouTube to make sure it wasn't YouTube freezing it

Thank you in advance for your time and help! :)
